intro: Manihot reniformis, commonly known as the arrowleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or forested areas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants such as cotton and hibiscus. Its growth habit is perennial, and it can reach heights of up to 3 meters.
